snippet: The country is hoping not to miss out on economic opportunities in China, which other European nations are courting.
abstract: British government takes steps toward reconciliation with China after months of frosty relations, promising to relax visa rules for Chinese businesspeople and some tourists; also says it has no plans for more high-profile meetings with the Dalai Lama, exiled Tibetan spiritual leader.
lead_paragraph: The country is hoping not to miss out on economic opportunities in China, which other European nations are courting.

headline.main: Britain Makes an Overture to Repair Ties With China
headline.print_headline: Britain Makes an Overture To Repair Ties With China
